sprintGoal: Complete forum with badges, leaderboards, polls, and Prompt Library

tasks.title: Implement badges system backend
tasks.description: Create badge framework with skill, activity, and special badges earned through achievements
acceptanceCriteria: badges table with types: skill, activity, special
Badge definitions: name, description, icon, criteria, rarity
Automatic badge awarding via background job
Badge progress tracking (e.g., '50/100 replies for badge')
Badges displayed on user profile and posts
Badge categories: Prompt Master, RAG Expert, Helpful, Popular, Beta Tester

technicalNotes.tables: badges (id, name, type, criteria_json, icon, rarity), user_badges (user_id, badge_id, earned_at, progress)
technicalNotes.cron: Bull queue checks badge criteria every hour
technicalNotes.badges: Seed: First Post, 100 Replies, Streak Master (7 days), 1000 Reputation, Accepted Answer, etc.

tasks.title: Build badges UI and badge gallery
tasks.description: Display badges on profiles and create badge showcase page
acceptanceCriteria: Badge display on user profile (earned + locked)
Badge cards show: icon, name, description, earned date
Badge rarity indicated by color (common, rare, epic, legendary)
Badges gallery at /badges shows all available badges
Filter badges by type and earned status

technicalNotes.toast: Use react-hot-toast for badge earned notifications

tasks.title: Implement leaderboards backend
tasks.description: Create leaderboards for top contributors weekly, monthly, and all-time
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/leaderboards/weekly returns top 50 users this week
GET /api/leaderboards/monthly returns top 50 users this month
Ranking based on reputation earned in timeframe
Include: rank, user, reputation_gain, post_count, accepted_answers
Hall of Fame for top monthly contributors (archived)
Performance: precomputed rankings, not realtime calculation

technicalNotes.cron: Bull queue recalculates rankings every hour
technicalNotes.calculation: Sum reputation_history WHERE created_at BETWEEN period_start AND period_end GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY sum DESC

tasks.title: Build leaderboards page
tasks.description: Create leaderboard display with tabs for weekly, monthly, all-time
acceptanceCriteria: Tabs: Weekly, Monthly, All-Time, Hall of Fame
Each entry shows: rank, avatar, username, reputation, badges

tasks.title: Implement polls system backend
tasks.description: Create poll creation, voting, and results tracking for topics
acceptanceCriteria: Results shown after voting or after deadline

technicalNotes.tables: polls (id, topic_id, question, type, deadline, anonymous), poll_options (id, poll_id, option_text, vote_count), poll_votes (user_id, poll_id, option_id)

tasks.title: Build poll UI and voting interface
tasks.description: Create poll creation widget and voting interface in topics
acceptanceCriteria: Poll builder in topic creation form
Vote buttons (radio for single, checkbox for multiple)
Results shown as bar chart with percentages
Lock voting after deadline or after user votes (single_choice)

tasks.title: Implement Prompt Library backend
tasks.description: Create community prompt repository with rating, forking, and categorization
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt fields: title, content, category, use_case, model, author_id
GET /api/prompts returns prompt library with filters
Categories: content_creation, code_generation, analysis, education, etc.
Template format with metadata (model, temperature, max_tokens)
Search and filter by category, use_case, model, rating

technicalNotes.tables: prompts (id, user_id, parent_id, title, content, category, use_case, model, template_json, rating_avg, vote_score), prompt_ratings (user_id, prompt_id, rating)
technicalNotes.fork: Copy prompt, set parent_id to original, increment fork_count

tasks.title: Build Prompt Library UI
tasks.description: Create prompt browsing, creation, and forking interface
acceptanceCriteria: Grid of prompt cards with title, excerpt, rating, votes
Shows: full prompt, metadata, template format, author, forks
Fork button (opens editor with pre-filled content)
Create prompt form with template editor

tasks.title: Test forum advanced features (Sprint 6)
tasks.description: Test badges, leaderboards, polls, and Prompt Library
acceptanceCriteria: Badges award correctly when criteria met
Voting works for single and multiple choice
Prompt Library displays and filters correctly

scenarios: Vote in poll and view results

deliverables: Prompt Library with forking and rating
notes: Sprint 6 adds gamification and community tools. Badges and leaderboards drive engagement. Prompt Library is a unique feature that adds value for LLM practitioners. Consider adding prompt templates for common use cases.
risks: Badge criteria detection may be computationally expensive
Leaderboard calculation may need optimization for scale
Prompt content moderation may be challenging
